reviews.review_msg: Lara was a great prof! She is very caring (would bring us tea and coffee) and passionate about her teaching. Her lectures were easy to follow, but the notes she gives is more of a skeleton so it helps to attend and take your own notes as well. She uses Twilight as a course reading which is great! Her midterm and final were fair, all written.

The lectures themselves are fine it's the exam which is going to shock you. She marks on a super strict rubric and is super particular and the midterm was all written. If it says write 5 sentences on the mid term that is a lie she really wants every single fact you can put on the topic which is a lot more than 5 sentences. Don't take this class ...

Lara is a fantastic prof and is a great introductory professor for a lower division class. She's kind, and genuinely wants you to succeed in the class. Her slides are uploaded online, however to fully grasp the course content going to class is necessary. Assignments and tests were easy.

Currently taking GSWS 101 online with her and Catherine Gidney. By far the worst class. Assignments are boring, weekly discussions you need to write a lot to get full marks, assignments UNCLEAR, and for the final, be prepared to memorize 40 definitions and make 14 essay outlines. GOODLUCK, don't take..

GSWS 101 IS SUCH A GOOD COURSE. Lara is one of my favourite profs I have ever had at SFU! She is really easy to understand and her lectures are awesome. The midterm was marked pretty hard, so just be super specific and explicit and you should get full marks. Lara is really organized and you can tell she knows her stuff but relaxed and easy-going.
Absolutely amazing! She's a great lecturer who is very knowledgeable and passionate about the material. Everyone should take at least one class with Lara before they graduate.

She is an amazing person and a great prof, very clear to understand her as she is an excellent lecturer. The course material was actually surprisingly interesting and eye opening. I really enjoyed this class and thought it was well structured.

Lara is a decent lecturer, but often fails to provide both sides of an argument. She gives out the terms that will be tested prior to the exams, so you have time to study, but you have to have specific points about the term or you will lose marks (messed up one question, brought my mark down a decent amount). You will read a lot of articles.

Her powerpoint are quite cryptic so it's very important that you actually go to lectures, but she is a really great prof with a lot of interest in the subject. She is really really helpful outside of class if you seek her out. I really hope I get to be in another one of her classes!

Lara is sooooo sweet! Her exams are very easy and straightforward (she gives you the questions ahead of time). However you CANNOT plan on skipping lots of classes and still doing well. Her powerpoint slides are very vague so taking notes is a MUST. There's also 4 debates in tutorial but they are very easy to ace.

Learned a lot in this class, wish I took it earlier in my degree so i could minor in GSWS. Lara is very clear and gives good interesting lectures, all the reading is fairly interesting and up to date.

Honestly, One of the best profs I've ever had. Her lectures were clear and concise and her lectures were always interactive and entertaining. The TA's were very nice, and generous with their grading. would highly recommend her!

Lara is such a wonderful person and teacher which makes attending her lectures really inspirational and eye-opening. everyone should take a class with her. she's very sweet, encouraging and full of openness for anyone. i actually got excited going into her lectures, because she always talks about things everyone can relate to

Lara is such an amazing prof! She's very engaging in lecture, and doesn't read the slides verbatim (take notes if you want to do well - the slides don't offer much help). She very clearly outlines what she wants for the exam (I got 100% on the midterm!). I would take another class with her in a heartbeat, THE BEST PROF I've ever had.
Awesome teacher, very kind, course is straight-forward, easy to understand, very interesting, and she is soooooooo cute omg
This was an interesting class and Lara is a nice Professor. It can be a lot of readings, so it can become a hard class. She can also be a tough marker, so watch out but she is friendly and helpful.

she's really nice, but i found the articles for class and for the debates only represented on e side of the arguments.. i found she generalizes feminists opinions and didn't really provide alternate ones.. but it was an easy class with little readings

While the class is easy and interesting, she doesn't do a good job of providing a fair representation of both sides of an argument.  She presents the side the majority agrees with and glazes over the opposition.  She expected us to use articles she provided to show both sides of debates when the articles were all skewed towards her side.

Lara is a nice person, but has little to no knowledge of the subject she teaches. Her background is in history, not human sexuality, and that shows.  She often presented only one side of issues and the assignments are nowhere near academic. It's like taking a high school class all over again.

I loved this class! Dr. Campbell made lectures interesting and relevant. There was no textbook (only internet readings), and her powerpoint slides only gave brief outlines of the topics, so attendance and thorough notetaking are mandatory. I didn't mind though, because the lectures always held my attention and got me thinking.

I took this class because I thought it would be an easy class  but I never knew I would end up learning so much. This class does have a lot of work (readings, debates, paper midterm + final) but Lara is really clear and helpful. She doesn't throw feminism at you in a harsh way. She is amazing and you learn a lot from her.

I love Campbell! I would take another class with her for sure. She's very clear. She tells you exactly what to study for the exams. Class was interesting. One of my fave classes. Make sure to take notes on what she is saying and not just copy it off the powerpoint or else you'll look back and not know what it is for the exam

LOVE this prof!! she is extremely clear and knows what she is teaching. Make sure you not only take down notes of what the slides show but most importantly, write down what she says. She examine you mainly on what she says in class. Fair marker and exam are pretty easy (Since you give you prior to exam)

Lectures are interesting, but require a lot of note taking. The midterms and final questions are given out beforehand; however, in order to answer the questions on the exam you need to be able to reiterate the selective points made in the lectures. The tutorials are very fun so be sure to attend them!

Fantastic prof. She is engaging, lectures are comprehensive and straightforward, and the material is very interesting. She is a hard marker but if you study you'll do fine. Super nice and very helpful too (she let me take my exam 2 days late because I was supposed to write 3 in one day).

such an easy class. she gives you a list of terms to study from prior to the exam and you have to write 8 terms out of a choice of 12. i take her 317 class too so the format is the same. the topics are very interesting and lara doesnt shove the feminists views down your throat. very down to earth, open-minded and great lady. so helpful and nice :)

Communicates well with her visual powerpoint. She is very good prof, cares about students, lectures are interesting; put effort into assignment and you will be fine. Really, in my fourth year, she is one of the best one

A very organized professor who gave the perfect amount of work for a first year course. Women's Studies wasn't my thing at first, but she presented very fair arguments. Not too preachy and a very fun class!

Lectures were interesting and sometimes entertaining. Sometimes hard to follow her powerpoint notes however, so additional notes as she speaks or very good memory and understanding are required to do well in the class.
very helpful prof and lecture notes are useful for studying, preparing for mid term and exam. assignments are okay and readings are required for good grade on assignments!
great prof! very clear and to the point. marks pretty hard and expects waaaayy too much for a 100 level course.

The class was interesting and the topics Campbell discussed were stimulating. She handed out exam questions before tests, however, the amount of questions she expected us to prepare for was overwhelming, and she marks too hard for a first year course. Also, the TA was horrible!

Lectures are interesting and very easy to follow. Gives out midterma and exam q's ahead of time so there are no surprises. Lots of stuff to do for the course ie reading responses,essay proposal, essay. but over all a great prof

This course was alot of work (lots of reading). Need to know the material well for the midterm and final from the readings. DO NOT BOTHER WITH THE TEXTBOOK, WAS NOT REQUIRED, JUST A SUGGESTION. Be prepaded to write 5 assignments (1pg), 3 Debates (1-2pages), Final essay worth 25%, Thesis propsal 10%,participate in tutorials (worth marks). final 25%

Clear, well-organized, logical, fine speaking voice, excellent visual aids, thorough handouts.
 WS-101 is HARD WORK (like 3rd year course).
 Textbook+Novel+30 Readings+Exam+Mid-Term Test+Tutorial Participation+4 Debates+26 assignments
 (Proposal+Essay+4 Debate Notes+10 Reading Responses [3 Readings each]+10 sets Participation Questions [51 total])

Very sweet, upbeat, perky, and accomodating toward students.  The class was composed of many smaller items as opposed to few large items (worth a big chunk of one's mark) so I feel it was more fair that way.  She's a fair marker.

She's a very sweet and helpful prof but the exams are BRUTAL! It is way too long; she expects you to write a 2 page essay on one topic and 4 page essay on another!!! it's sinle spaced btw. On top of that you have to do 4-5 vocabs, each have to be a aprrox. half a page. The TA was bad and not helpful at all and worst of all she marks hard.
Wow Laura is a GREAT prof, and I had a great TA. Its a really good course, highly recommended.
she's very sweet, and dedicated to her field.  I thought the exams were pretty long though.  The TAs are terrible.

Lara is a great lecturer and very helpful professor. In ws 202 the course was over and we still did not have the majority of our marks even though final exam was the first day of exams. Papers returned once summer semster had started. WS sets the bar higher ie an A is 90 - 94% and Lara marks hard.
Lara is a super prof.  She is respectful towards the students and values their opinion.  I would definetely take another course with her.

She is an awesome professor. Extremely helpful and approachable. I would definitely take another class with her. We need more helpful and friendly profs. TA's SUCK! They mark with impossible and unfair standards. Prof's great, TA sucks.

Get test questions ahead of time so exams are easy. assignments marked kind of hard. very subjective process. She is a very good teacher though: helpful, clear and approachable. TA sucked though so be very careful.
Lara is an amazing prof, she is so dedicated and so willing to help out. Take this class it is relevant to so many subjects

Lara is a great professor. Her notes are clear and she is obviously passionate about women's issues. She is also very approachable and she takes time to listen to her students. I would definately take another class with her.
Rahat is a really bad T.A. Prof is a hard marker. Not recommended. Won't make you want to take women's studies again
No Comments
Shes good. But DO NOT TAKE A TUT WITH RAHAT. The worst TA ever.
A good lecturer but the TA Rahat marks very hard. Most peoples marks lower than they are use to. Watch you don't miss any points on the tests
Wish there were more profs in this dept.  She'll bore you to tears.  Her TA is brutal.
a very good lecturer, adds some humor. Tests very fair, gives you questions ahead of time.
